meanings.definition: A compound released by cells in response to injury or allergic and inflammatory reactions, causing contraction of smooth muscle and dilation of capillaries.
meanings.sent1: Histamins play a role in allergic reactions by causing muscle contraction and capillary dilation.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study histamins to understand how they affect the body during inflammation.
meanings.sent3: The histamins in the body decided to throw a party, causing all the muscles to dance and blood vessels to widen.
meanings.sent4: Her anger was like histamins, causing her to tighten up and her emotions to flow freely.
meanings.sent5: The histamins were like tiny messengers, delivering signals for the body to react to injuries and allergies.

meanings.definition: A substance that is released by cells in response to injury and in allergic and inflammatory reactions, causing contraction of smooth muscle and dilation of capillaries.
meanings.sent1: When histamins are released, they can lead to muscle contraction and capillary dilation.
meanings.sent2: The doctor explained how histamins can trigger allergic reactions in the body.
meanings.sent3: The histamins at the party were the life of the cell, making everyone move and expand.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like histamins, causing a reaction in him that he couldn't control.
meanings.sent5: Histamins are like little messengers that deliver important signals during injuries and allergies.
